message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
```java
Iterator<Enemy> iterator = enemyList.iterator();    
while (iterator.hasNext()) {        
    Enemy e = iterator.next();        
    if(e!=null && e.isActive()){            
        e.move();            
        e.draw(g);            
        if(e.edgeHit()){                
            Iterator<Enemy> downwardIterator = enemyList.iterator();                
            while (downwardIterator.hasNext()) {                    
                Enemy de = downwardIterator.next();                    
                de.dropPosition();                    
                de.changeDirection();                
            }            
        }        
    }        
    else{            
        iterator.remove();        
    }    
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The error message you are seeing is due to the fact that you are calling `downwardIterator.next()` without first checking if there is a next element in the list with `downwardIterator.hasNext()`. The `NoSuchElementException` is thrown by the `next()` method of an `Iterator` when there are no more elements in the list to iterate over. In your nested while loop, you are mistakenly using `iterator.hasNext()` instead of `downwardIterator.hasNext()`. This is causing the `NoSuchElementException` because `iterator` has already reached the end of the list in the outer loop, so when you call `iterator.hasNext()` in the inner loop, it returns false, but you still try to call `downwardIterator.next()`, which throws the exception. To fix this, you should replace `iterator.hasNext()` with `downwardIterator.hasNext()` in the inner loop.
